entry.et: Middle English spinnen, from Old English spinnan; akin to Old High German spinnan to spin and perhaps to Lithuanian spęsti to set (a trap)

def.dt: :to draw out and twist fiber into yarn or thread
:to form a thread by extruding a viscous rapidly hardening fluid used especially of a spider or insect
:to revolve rapidly :gyrate
:to feel as if in a whirl :reel my head is spinning
:to move swiftly especially on or as if on wheels or in a vehicle
:to fish with spinning bait :troll
:to fall in a spin
:to plunge helplessly and out of control
:to engage in spin control (as in politics)
:to draw out and twist into yarns or threads
:to produce by drawing out and twisting a fibrous material
:to form (as a web or cocoon) by spinning
:to stretch out or extend (as a story) lengthily :protract usually used with out
:to evolve, express, or fabricate by processes of mind or imagination spin a yarn
:to cause to whirl :impart spin to spin a top
:to shape into threadlike form in manufacture
:to manufacture by a whirling process
:to set (records or compact discs) rotating on a player :play spin some discs
:to present (as information) with a particular spin spin the statistics
:to make futile efforts to achieve progress
:the act of spinning or twirling something
:an instance of spinning or of spinning something doing axels and spins an assortment of spins and lobs
:the whirling motion imparted (as to a ball or top) by spinning
:an excursion or ride in a vehicle especially on wheels go for a spin
:an aerial maneuver or flight condition consisting of a combination of roll and yaw with the longitudinal axis of the airplane inclined steeply downward
:a plunging descent or downward spiral
:a state of mental confusion all in a spin
:a quantum characteristic of an elementary particle that is visualized as the rotation of the particle on its axis and that is responsible for measurable angular momentum and magnetic moment
:the angular momentum associated with such rotation whose magnitude is quantized and which may assume either of two possible directions
:the angular momentum of a system of such particles derived from the spins and orbital motions of the particles
:a usually ingenious twist puts an Asian spin on the pasta dishes
:a special point of view, emphasis, or interpretation presented for the purpose of influencing opinion put the most favorable spin on the findings
:spin control
:the act or practice of attempting to manipulate the way an event is interpreted by others political spin control
:a person (as a political aide) responsible for ensuring that others interpret an event from a particular point of view
:spinning
:to establish or produce as a spin-off the company spun off its computer division spin off a new TV series
:to establish or become a spin-off
:the distribution by a business to its stockholders of particular assets and especially of stock of another company
:the new company created by such a distribution
:a collateral or derived product or effect :by-product
:a number of such products the spin–off from the space program
:something that is imitative or derivative of an earlier work, product, or establishment
:a television show starring a character popular in a secondary role of an earlier show
:to make a rotational skid in an automobile
